docs.title: Movian Media Player - Developer Documentation
docs.text: Movian is a cross-platform media player designed for home theater PCs, set-top boxes, and embedded devices. This comprehensive documentation provides everything developers need to understand, extend, and contribute to the Movian ecosystem.

docs.title: 🎯 What is Movian?
docs.text:
Movian is a powerful, extensible media player that combines:

  • Native Performance: Written in C/C++ for optimal performance on resource-constrained devices
  • Plugin Architecture: JavaScript-based plugin system for content providers and extensions
  • Custom UI Engine: GLW (OpenGL Widget) system for creating responsive, themeable interfaces
  • Cross-Platform: Runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, Android, PlayStation 3, and Raspberry Pi
  • Media Focus: Optimized for video playback with support for numerous codecs and formats

echo "=== Build Configuration ==="
if [ -f build.linux/config.mak ]; then

docs.title: GLW View File Examples
docs.text: This directory contains working examples of Movian's GLW (OpenGL Widget) view files.

docs.title: Important Note
docs.text:
Movian view files use JavaScript-like syntax, NOT XML!

The GLW system uses a functional approach with widget() calls and property objects, similar to JavaScript frameworks like React or Vue.

docs.title: Basic Syntax
docs.text:
// Correct GLW syntax
widget(container_y, {
    spacing: 1em;
    padding: 2em;

    widget(label, {
        caption: "Hello World";
        align: center;
        color: 1.0;
    });
});

NOT XML syntax: 

<!-- This is WRONG for Movian -->
<widget type="container_y">
    <property name="spacing" value="1em"/>
    <widget type="label">
        <property name="caption" value="Hello World"/>
    </widget>
</widget>

docs.title: basic-layout.view
docs.text: Comprehensive example showing: - Container layouts (vertical and horizontal) - Text labels with styling - Images and icons - Interactive elements with focus states - Scrollable lists with cloners - Custom macros for reusable components - Event handling

docs.title: 1. Widget Hierarchy
docs.text:
widget(container_y, {
    widget(container_x, {
        widget(label, {
            caption: "Nested widgets";
        });
    });
});

docs.title: 2. Property Syntax
docs.text:
widget(label, {
    caption: "Text content";        // String property
    sizeScale: 1.5;                // Number property
    color: 1.0;                    // Color (0.0 to 1.0)
    hidden: false;                 // Boolean property
    align: center;                 // Enum/constant
});

docs.title: 3. Interactive States
docs.text:
widget(container_z, {
    focusable: true;

    widget(quad, {
        // Dynamic alpha based on interaction state
        alpha: 0.6 + 0.4 * iir(isNavFocused() + isPressed() + isHovered(), 4, true);
    });

    onEvent(activate, navOpen("some:url"));
});

docs.title: 4. Data Binding
docs.text:
cloner($self.model.nodes, container_z, {
    widget(label, {
        caption: $self.metadata.title;  // Bind to data
    });
});

docs.title: 5. Macros and Reusability
docs.text:
#define BUTTON(CAPTION, EVENT) {
    widget(container_z, {
        focusable: true;
        widget(label, {
            caption: CAPTION;
        });
        onEvent(activate, EVENT);
    });
}

// Usage
BUTTON("Click Me", navOpen("target:url"));

docs.title: Layout Properties
docs.text:
• width, height - Size constraints
  • padding - Internal spacing [top, right, bottom, left]
  • margin - External spacing
  • spacing - Space between child widgets
  • align - Alignment (left, center, right, top, bottom)

docs.title: Visual Properties
docs.text:
• color - Color (0.0 to 1.0 or hex "#RRGGBB")
  • alpha - Transparency (0.0 to 1.0)
  • hidden - Visibility (true/false)

  • maxlines - Maximum text lines

docs.title: State Functions
docs.text:
• isNavFocused() - Widget has navigation focus
  • isHovered() - Mouse is over widget
  • isPressed() - Widget is being pressed

docs.title: File Organization
docs.text:
View files are typically organized as: 

plugin/
├── views/
│   ├── main.view          # Main layout
│   ├── item.view          # Item template
│   └── common.view        # Shared macros
└── plugin.json

docs.title: Including Other Files
docs.text:
#import "common.view"       // Import macros and definitions
#include "header.view"      // Include content inline

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use Macros: Create reusable components with #define
  2. Consistent Naming: Use clear, descriptive names
  3. Proper Nesting: Organize widgets logically
  4. Performance: Avoid deep nesting and complex expressions
  5. Accessibility: Ensure proper focus navigation

docs.title: Debugging View Files
docs.text:
• Check Movian's log for syntax errors
  • Use simple layouts first, then add complexity
  • Test focus navigation with keyboard/remote
  • Verify data binding with known values
